p: In a middle-aged and elderly population in the Netherlands from predominantly West-European descent, we found that 97% of this population would be eligible to participate in any of the nine currently ongoing vaccine trials against SARS-CoV-2. For persons at high-risk of severe COVID-19, the eligibility for any trial was 96%. Importantly, applying stricter exclusion based on the criterion ‘acute’ or ‘unstable preexisting’ disease drastically reduced the eligibility for any trial to 43% of the entire study population and 36% of the high-risk individuals.
